com.inqwell.any

Interface Plugin

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPlugin, DummyPlugin

    public interface Plugin
    An adapter to interface some external system to the Inq environment.
    Author:
    Tom

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void begin()
      Starts an Inq transaction.
      String create(Map m)
      Called by the external system to indicate that the entity represented by this plugin should be created.
      boolean delete(Map m)
      Called by the external system to indicate that the entity represented by this plugin should be deleted.
      void end(boolean commit)
      Commits the transaction opened by begin().
      void modify(Map m)
      Called by the external system to indicate that the entity represented by this plugin should be updated.
      void start(Map argsMap)
      Performs any initialisation required by the external environment.
      void stop()
      Performs any closedown required by the external environment.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(Map argsMap)
        Performs any initialisation required by the external environment. Any exceptions that occur must be caught and if required rethrown by wrapping in a RuntimeContainedException
        Parameters:
        argsMap - An Inq Map that the implementation can query for, say, configuration parameters. Often the command line arguments specified when the Inq environment was launched.
        Throws:
        RuntimeContainedException - if any kind of error occurs in the external environment. environment

      • stop

        void stop()
        Performs any closedown required by the external environment. Any exceptions that occur must be caught and if required rethrown by wrapping in a RuntimeContainedException
        Throws:
        RuntimeContainedException - if any kind of error occurs in the external environment. environment

      • begin

        void begin()
        Starts an Inq transaction. If called by the external environment, all calls to create(Map), modify(Map) and delete(Map) have their effects deferred until the transaction is committed by calling end(boolean)

        If these methods throw an exception while a transaction is open then all actions hitherto are discarded. The external environment may continue with further actions and if no exceptions are encountered these will be committed when end(boolean) is called.

        If begin() is not called then actions submitted are committed after each invocation of those methods. begin() cannot be called more than once before end(boolean) is called to close the transaction.

        Throws:
        AnyRuntimeException - if a transaction is already open.

      • create

        String create(Map m)
        Called by the external system to indicate that the entity represented by this plugin should be created.
        Parameters:
        m - a Map containing an agreed key/value set representing the entity to be created.
        Returns:
        a unique identifier for the created entity
        Throws:
        AnyRuntimeException - if any kind of error occurs in the Inq environment

      • modify

        void modify(Map m)
        Called by the external system to indicate that the entity represented by this plugin should be updated.
        Parameters:
        m - a Map containing an agreed key/value set representing the entity to be updated.
        Throws:
        AnyRuntimeException - if any kind of error occurs in the Inq environment

      • delete

        boolean delete(Map m)
        Called by the external system to indicate that the entity represented by this plugin should be deleted.
        Parameters:
        m - a Map containing an agreed key/value set representing the entity to be deleted.
        Returns:
        true if the entity existed and was scheduled for deletion, false if it did not exist in the first place.
        Throws:
        AnyRuntimeException - if any kind of error occurs in the Inq environment

      • end

        void end(boolean commit)
        Commits the transaction opened by begin(). If no transaction was opened this method has no effect.

        Note: If begin() is called and later an exception is thrown while submitting actions to create() or modify() then the external environment must still call end() to tidy the transaction state.

        Parameters:
        commit - if true then the transaction (if open) is committed. Otherwise it is rolled back.
        Throws:
        AnyRuntimeException - if some error occurs during the commit.
